availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, editor. Preston, Connecticut native. Son of Rufus Prentice and Sarah Stanton Prentice. Married to Harriet G. Benham Prentice in Louisville, Kentucky, on August 18, 1835. Father of William Courtland Prentice, Harriet Prentice, Clarence Joseph Prentice, and Amelia Prentice. Attended Brown University at Providence, Rhode Island, from 1820 to 1823. Studied law in Canterbury, Connecticut. Editor of the Connecticut Mirror in 1827. Editor of the Hartford New England Review in Hartford, Connecticut, in 1828. Author in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1830. Editor of the Louisville Journal from 1830 until 1868. Employed Fortunatus Cosby as an editor in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 3, p. 277B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Ward 2, p. 572.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film #000817873, p. 184.
Thomas D. Clark, "George Dennison Prentice," in John E. Kleber, ed., The Encyclopedia of Louisville (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 2001), 722-23.
